events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle hitting a guardrail on April 30th, requesting to file the claim immediately.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and damage description provided by the customer.
An agent from the auto claims department has been assigned to manage the investigation and follow up with the customer.
Confirmation sent to the customer acknowledging receipt of the claim and assuring prompt assistance with their vehicle damage case.
Requested documents from the customer include the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the vehicle registration copy.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos, police report, and vehicle ownership proof for claim processing.
Investigation into the accident circumstances and damage extent was initiated by the claims adjuster assigned to the case.
Investigator completed review confirming the collision damage was consistent with customer’s report and no contributory negligence found.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the vehicle repair estimate and policy coverage limits provided to the customer.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the support throughout the claim process.
Claim formally approved by the insurance team following customer’s acceptance of the settlement terms and conditions.
Insurance payment was issued to the customer’s bank account covering the approved vehicle repair costs promptly.
The claim was officially closed after confirming repair completion and customer satisfaction with the settlement outcome.
Claim documents and investigation files were archived securely in the insurance system for future reference and compliance.
